title: Tom reveals Gatsby's bootlegging activities and connections to Wolfshiem, shocking Daisy.

space. With an effort she glanced down at the table.

“You always look so cool,” she repeated.

She had told him that she loved him, and Tom Buchanan saw. He was
astounded. His mouth opened a little, and he looked at Gatsby, and
then back at Daisy as if he had just recognized her as someone he knew
a long time ago.

relations.explanation: Gatsby's house lights are no longer on, marking the end of his extravagant parties. He fires his servants to prevent gossip about Daisy's visits.
Wolfshiem wanted to do something for the people who are now Gatsby's servants.
The butler announces the arrival of Gatsby and Nick and takes their hats.
Jordan whispers that the person on the telephone is 'Tom's girl'.
Daisy kisses Gatsby on the mouth and says 'You know I love you'
Pammy rushed across the room and rooted shyly into her mother’s dress. Daisy says 'She looks like me. She’s got my hair and shape of the face.'
Gatsby kept looking at the child with surprise. I don’t think he had ever really believed in its existence before.
She had told him that she loved him, and Tom Buchanan saw.
